intro: Clitoria glycinoides var. megapotamica, commonly known as the yellow butterfly pea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its distinctive butterfly-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a climbing vine with trifoliate leaves and produces vibrant yellow or orange flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The seeds are encased in a pod and can be used in traditional medicine and as a natural dye.
